text: Everyone talks about how, in your 30s, all of these growing pains transition into wisdom and you feel more self-assured and confident, but I think I had a bit of a jump-start on that at 27.
author: Solange Knowles

text: Learn as much by writing as by reading.
author: Lord Acton

text: I'd marry again if I found a man who had fifteen million dollars, would sign over half to me, and guarantee that he'd be dead within a year.
author: Bette Davis

text: The paradox is that when we model future designs on past successes, we are inviting failure down the line; when we take into account past failures and anticipate potential new ways in which failure can occur, we are more likely to produce successful designs.
author: Henry Petroski

text: Anyone who thinks that the vice-president can take a position independent of the president of his administration simply has no knowledge of politics or government. You are his choice in a political marriage, and he expects your absolute loyalty.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

text: How easy to be amiable in the midst of happiness and success.
author: William Ellery Channing

text: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Immanuel Kant

text: I think I've always been somebody, since the deaths of my father and brother, who was afraid to hope. So, I was more prepared for failure and for rejection than for success.
author: Amy Tan

text: Animals that we eat are raised for food in the most economical way possible, and the serious food producers do it in the most humane way possible. I think anyone who is a carnivore needs to understand that meat does not originally come in these neat little packages.
author: Julia Child

text: Think big thoughts but relish small pleasures.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: The unsuccessful person is burdened by learning, and prefers to walk down familiar paths. Their distaste for learning stunts their growth and limits their influence.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: Shows like 'Sex and the City' got women involved again in a political way. They were drawn into the personal stories of the four women who together make up one complete cosmopolitan woman. We want to have community, and the show filled that void in our lives: friendship between women.
author: Kim Cattrall

text: Wisdom comes from within. Knowledge is acquired and can sometimes put a screen on your wisdom.
author: A. R. Rahman

text: When I got to France I realized I didn't know very much about food at all. I'd never had a real cake. I'd had those cakes from cake mixes or the ones that have a lot of baking powder in them. A really good French cake doesn't have anything like that in it - it's all egg power.
author: Julia Child

text: If you really want to make a friend, go to someone's house and eat with him... the people who give you their food give you their heart.
author: Cesar Chavez

text: But the fact that same-sex marriage is still an issue is insane. Thinking love knows a sex is ridiculous.
author: Garret Dillahunt

text: Love is my religion - I could die for it.
author: John Keats

text: Just as the soul fills the body, so God fills the world. Just as the soul bears the body, so God endures the world. Just as the soul sees but is not seen, so God sees but is not seen. Just as the soul feeds the body, so God gives food to the world.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: I think, with Hank Paulson, the concept of a bailout was anathema to him from day one. He was a Republican; he's a free marketeer. He believes in capitalism, and part of capitalism is believing in failure. And so the idea of bailing out an institution, I think, went against every part of him.
author: Andrew Ross Sorkin

text: When we talk about 9/11 and 26/11 - which is the shorthand for the Mumbai attacks in 2008 - we're talking about the most successful terrorist attacks in history. When you start trying to study the most successful event of its kind, it actually doesn't make for great fiction because there isn't the kind of failure in it that fiction thrives on.
author: Karan Mahajan

text: I absolutely love spending time with my family.
author: Kevin Alejandro

text: Nature and books belong to the eyes that see them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: I've heard stories of people, even celebrities that have gone online, pretended to be someone they weren't, and conducted a 5-year friendship via e-mail. Then, they got married because they really love each other from all that communication.
author: Diane Lane

text: Your net worth to the world is usually determined by what remains after your bad habits are subtracted from your good ones.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Airline glamour never promised anything as mundane as elbow room, much less a flat bed, a massage, or an arugula salad. It promised a better world. Service and dress reflected the more formal era, but no one expected air travel to be comfortable. It was amazing just to have hot food above the clouds.
author: Virginia Postrel

text: Even though people may be well known, they hold in their hearts the emotions of a simple person for the moments that are the most important of those we know on earth: birth, marriage and death.
author: Jackie Kennedy

text: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: I get unhappy doing things that I'm not passionate about. Because I feel like I'm squandering this incredible gift I've been given to finance films. As soon as my name alone was enough to make this happen, I vowed to myself that I was going to work with directors who were changing cinema, doing something important, you know?
author: Leonardo DiCaprio

text: I refuse to accept the view that mankind is so tragically bound to the starless midnight of racism and war that the bright daybreak of peace and brotherhood can never become a reality... I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: I think I will always be performing; I don't think I can take that away. Because I really just enjoy it. I like getting up to sing; I like the challenge of learning new material and singing it in front of an audience.
author: Lea Salonga

text: Staying married may have long-term benefits. You can elicit much more sympathy from friends over a bad marriage than you ever can from a good divorce.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

text: The Middle East is ailing. The malady stems from pervasive violence, shortages of food, water and educational opportunities, discrimination against women and - the most virulent cause of all - the absence of freedom.
author: Shimon Peres

text: I'm single, footloose and fancy free, I have no responsibilities, no anchors. Work, friendship and self-improvement, that's me.
author: Joel Edgerton

text: I love fresh fruit and vegetables. I'm not a strict dieter. I don't think that anything in life should be so regimented that you're not having fun or can't enjoy like everybody else. Just know that fresh food is always going to be better for you.
author: Carrie Ann Inaba

text: I feel like I'm really blessed and lucky that I have a very good social life outside of the gym, and I have a really amazing family. My parents are so supportive. I have a younger brother and two younger sisters, and they're really awesome. So I feel like I get the best of both worlds.
author: Aly Raisman

text: The great question is not whether you have failed, but whether you are content with failure.
author: Laurence J. Peter

text: Success is simply a matter of luck. Ask any failure.
author: Earl Wilson

text: Marriage is tough. I can tell my wife all day long that I love her, but it doesn't mean anything if you don't show that.
author: Jeff Nichols

text: Every one in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
author: Maria Montessori

text: I live a very joyful life, with a lot of laughter and good times.
author: Kimberly Elise

text: Life is the most exciting opportunity we have. But we have one shot. You graduate from college once, and that's it. You're going out of that nest. And you have to find that courage that's deep, deep, deep in there. Every step of the way.
author: Andrew Shue

text: I had some of the students in my finance class actually do some empirical work on capital structures, to see if we could find any obvious patterns in the data, but we couldn't see any.
author: Merton Miller

text: Instead of loving your enemies - treat your friends a little better.
author: E. W. Howe

text: Never say never, but the thought of electively cutting oneself is beyond my grasp, and I also object to it politically. Denying the lines on our faces makes a comment about age and wisdom I don't care to make.
author: Debra Winger

text: Theology in general seems to me a substitution of human ingenuity for divine wisdom.
author: Julia Ward Howe

text: I'm not going to school just for the academics - I wanted to share ideas, to be around people who are passionate about learning.
author: Emma Watson

text: We learn wisdom from failure much more than from success. We often discover what will do, by finding out what will not do; and probably he who never made a mistake never made a discovery.
author: Samuel Smiles

text: So confident am I in the intentions, as well as wisdom, of the government, that I shall always be satisfied that what is not done, either cannot, or ought not to be done.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Up until Trump announced his candidacy, the conventional wisdom was that you had to be a professional politician in order to run. You had to have a background that was politically scrubbed. In other words, smart people who didn't live perfect lives could never run.
author: Mark Cuban

text: Through Love all that is bitter will be sweet, Through Love all that is copper will be gold, Through Love all dregs will become wine, through Love all pain will turn to medicine.
author: Rumi

text: If something's important enough, you should try. Even if you - the probable outcome is failure.
author: Elon Musk

text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

text: Money can buy you a fine dog, but only love can make him wag his tail.
author: Kinky Friedman

text: Faith has a role to play in life. It is not related to success. It is the other way round. Success is related to faith. Faith comes first.
author: Andrea Bocelli

text: Here's a news flash: No soldier gives his life. That's not the way it works. Most soldiers who make a conscious decision to place themselves in harm's way do it to protect their buddies. They do it because of the bonds of friendship - and it goes so much deeper than friendship.
author: Eric Massa

text: Instead of looking at life as a narrowing funnel, we can see it ever widening to choose the things we want to do, to take the wisdom we've learned and create something.
author: Liz Carpenter

text: It is better to be unhappy in love than unhappy in marriage, but some people manage to be both.
author: Guy de Maupassant

text: If having a soul means being able to feel love and loyalty and gratitude, then animals are better off than a lot of humans.
author: James Herriot

text: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
author: St. Jerome

text: Crave for a thing, you will get it. Renounce the craving, the object will follow you by itself.
author: Swami Sivananda

text: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: I love those who can smile in trouble, who can gather strength from distress, and grow brave by reflection. 'Tis the business of little minds to shrink, but they whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves their conduct, will pursue their principles unto death.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Who would give a law to lovers? Love is unto itself a higher law.
author: Boethius

text: If a process or adaptation seems too smart for nature, that's a failure of your imagination, not the hand of God. I can make that claim because we have a working model of life's morphing and molding without it.
author: Kyle Hill

text: I could be wrong, but I think heterosexual marriage is threatened more by heterosexuals. I don't know why gay marriage challenges my marriage in any way.
author: Elizabeth Edwards

text: I love the food, the girls, the sky and everything that is Delhi. I have very fond memories of the Moolchand flyover.
author: Vir Das

text: Food, love, career, and mothers, the four major guilt groups.
author: Cathy Guisewite

text: In Chicago, you have an absence of strong family units, and that absence gets filled by gangs. You have a failure in the school system, after-school programs and other social programs to help keep kids off the streets. Amnesty International speaks to that in some way, by keeping these issues in the forefront.
author: Lupe Fiasco

text: Find joy in everything you choose to do. Every job, relationship, home... it's your responsibility to love it, or change it.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: The philosophy of life is this: Life is not a struggle, not a tension... Life is bliss. It is eternal wisdom, eternal existence.
author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

text: What I believe is that marriage is between a man and a woman, but what I also believe is that we have an obligation to make sure that gays and lesbians have the rights of citizenship that afford them visitations to hospitals, that allow them to be, to transfer property between partners, to make certain that they're not discriminated on the job.
author: Barack Obama

text: What makes the bravery of the men and women of the FBI so special is that they know exactly what they're in for. They spend weeks and weeks in an academy learning just how hard and dangerous this work is. Then they raise their right hands and take an oath and do that work anyway.
author: James Comey

text: Well, I think that there's a very thin dividing line between success and failure. And I think if you start a business without financial backing, you're likely to go the wrong side of that dividing line.
author: Richard Branson

text: Water is life, and clean water means health.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Success is finding satisfaction in giving a little more than you take.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: I had been learning Italian for years. I always loved Latin, but Italian is a living language; I'm writing in it now as well as reading it. It is so interesting delving further into language.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri

text: In my mind, marriage is a spiritual partnership and union in which we willingly give and receive love, create and share intimacy, and open ourselves to be available and accessible to another human being in order to heal, learn and grow.
author: Iyanla Vanzant

text: I don't know which is stronger: the thrill of winning or the fear of failure. I don't know which one affects me most. I don't know where the middle is.
author: Tony McCoy

text: Success is due to our stretching to the challenges of life. Failure comes when we shrink from them.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: She's the kind of girl who climbed the ladder of success wrong by wrong.
author: Mae West

text: I sought my father in the world of the black musician, because it contained wisdom, experience, sadness and loneliness. I was not ever interested in the music of boys. From my youngest years, I was interested in the music of men.
author: Eric Clapton

text: The only risk of failure is promotion.
author: Scott Adams

text: My mother is a great source of advice and wisdom and consolation for me.
author: Katherine Heigl

text: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: We live too long for one marriage.
author: Yoko Ono

text: Without hard work, nothing grows but weeds.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

text: There is more wisdom in your body than in your deepest philosophy.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: I think that obstacles lead to growth and ultimately, the most learning I've done in my life is between jobs.
author: Anthony Michael Hall

text: We can only learn to love by loving.
author: Iris Murdoch

text: The best part of being a mom to me is the unconditional love. I have never felt a love as pure, a love that's as rewarding.
author: Monica Denise Brown

text: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
author: Sholom Aleichem

text: Friendship often ends in love; but love in friendship - never.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: If beef is your idea of 'real food for real people', you'd better live real close to a real good hospital.
author: Neal Barnard

text: I didn't know how to deal with success. If there was a Rock Star 101, I would have liked to take it. It might have helped me.
author: Kurt Cobain

text: I love food. I'm a big food person. I'm really passionate about eating good food all the time.
author: Dreama Walker

text: Marriage was never my goal, because I've never been very traditional.
author: Chrissy Teigen

text: Once, during Prohibition, I was forced to live for days on nothing but food and water.
author: W. C. Fields

text: Love is friendship set on fire.
author: Jeremy Taylor

text: The things that will destroy America are prosperity-at-any-price, peace-at-any-price, safety-first instead of duty-first, the love of soft living, and the get-rich-quick theory of life.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: One of the greatest and simplest tools for learning more and growing is doing more.
author: Washington Irving

text: I failed first grade, which is my biggest problem. You always feel like a failure, like you're stupid.
author: Amy Sedaris

text: Learning to celebrate success is a key component of learning how to win in the market.
author: Douglas Conant
